ERA5 rainfall – quick look

Minimal example using xarray + cfgrib (local GRIB files).
Replace PATH_TO_GRIB with your local file; this page won’t fetch data.

| echo: true

| fig-height: 5

| fig-width: 10

import xarray as xr import matplotlib.pyplot as plt import numpy as np

— ERA5 GRIB read (uncomment once you have files locally) —

path = “PATH_TO_GRIB/era5_tp_daily_2020-01-01.grib”

ds = xr.open_dataset(path, engine=“cfgrib”)

data = ds[‘tp’][0] # first timestep

lat = ds.latitude.values

lon = ds.longitude.values

— synthetic fallback for demo / CI / website build —

lat = np.linspace(-60,60,121) lon = np.linspace(-180,180,361) data = np.random.gamma(2, 1, (len(lat), len(lon)))

plt.figure() plt.imshow( data, extent=[lon.min(), lon.max(), lat.min(), lat.max()], origin=“lower” ) plt.title(“ERA5 total precipitation — mock plot (replace with ds[‘tp’][0])”) plt.xlabel(“longitude”) plt.ylabel(“latitude”) plt.show()

Source Code
---
title: ERA5 rainfall – quick look

> Minimal example using `xarray` + `cfgrib` (local GRIB files).  
> Replace `PATH_TO_GRIB` with your local file; this page won’t fetch data.

```{python}
# | echo: true
# | fig-height: 5
# | fig-width: 10
import xarray as xr
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

# --- ERA5 GRIB read (uncomment once you have files locally) ---
# path = "PATH_TO_GRIB/era5_tp_daily_2020-01-01.grib"
# ds = xr.open_dataset(path, engine="cfgrib")
# data = ds['tp'][0]  # first timestep
# lat = ds.latitude.values
# lon = ds.longitude.values

# --- synthetic fallback for demo / CI / website build ---
lat = np.linspace(-60,60,121)
lon = np.linspace(-180,180,361)
data = np.random.gamma(2, 1, (len(lat), len(lon)))

plt.figure()
plt.imshow(
    data,
    extent=[lon.min(), lon.max(), lat.min(), lat.max()],
    origin="lower"
)
plt.title("ERA5 total precipitation — mock plot (replace with ds['tp'][0])")
plt.xlabel("longitude")
plt.ylabel("latitude")
plt.show()
